revised_title: The First Devonian Tetrapod Discovery in Latvia
tldr: The article discusses the discovery of the first tetrapod, Ventastega curonica, from the Upper Devonian of Latvia. The findings provide new insights into the anatomy and evolution of early tetrapods, revealing primitive features and confirming the tetrapod status of Metaxygnathus. The discovery of this previously unrecognized Devonian tetrapod sheds light on the early stages of tetrapod evolution.
